Ian: I had you checked out.
Michael: Checked out?

Ian: Yeah. And if you're waiting for an apology, it's not coming. The church

Michael: Every word. So I guess I'm the one that owes you an apology. I just

Michael: Ian, please. You have to understand. You have to believe me -- I

Ian: That's not your job. It's not your wife and your child in harm's way

Michael: I understand.

Ian: Good. So I need you to leave tonight. I want you out of our lives

Michael: Thanks but no thanks, Eve. I'm -- I'm -- I don't have the time. I'm

Michael: Duty calls. There's a -- there's a soul I've been meaning to see,

Ian: You don't have to cover for me. We don't have secrets. As long as he's
